titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Janet Lewis Papers , 1964-1989
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Janet Lewis Papers ,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Janet Lewis Papers , M0543, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American writer of many genres, including novels, short stories, poetry and librettos. Many of her friends and correspondents were at one time students or colleagues of Yvor Winters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Incoming personal and professional correspondence, including letters from William Bergsma, Gus Blaisdell, Elizabeth Daryush, Donald Davie, John Edmunds, John Fraser, Richard Freis, Charles Gullans, Thom Gunn, Maurice Lesemann, N. Scott Momaday, Grosvenor Powell, Pearl Andelson Sherry, Ann Stanford and Donald E. Stanford. Some manuscripts by Janet Lewis and others. 3 photographs. Basically an addenda to M352, the papers of Yvor Winters and Janet Lewis, with the bulk of this material dated after 1982.

Manuscripts by Janet Lewis Winters

photocopy of a typescript by Janet Lewis Winters about Katherine Anne Porter, [n.d.].Poem, For Louise, regarding Louise Chenery transferred from Box 1, folder 23. Proof copy of The Indians in the Woods transferred from Box 4, folder 15. Proof copy of Betatakin First Seen, Autumn transferred from Box 4, folder 16.
Miscellanea by Janet Lewis Winters

Letters, notes, lists, addresses, etc. by Janet Lewis Winters, Jan. [1966] and before to Jan. 1981 [and after?].Includes Christmas greeting cards of the Lewis family dating from 1916, 1917, 1920,and 1 ph. of poem A Lullaby by Janet Lewis Winters.
Manuscripts by others
Poem by Janet's father, 6/2/05.
Poem by Margaret Henrichsen, 6/26/25.
Reviews of Janet Lewis Winter's works

1 ph. review of Good-bye, Son, April 14, 1946.Reviews of Poems Old and New: 1918 - 1978, April 1981 to Sept. 1982.Carbon typescript of a review of The Wife of Martin Guerre by Evan Connell transferred from Box 2, folder 3.
Miscellaneous items sent to Janet Lewis Winters

Flyers, invoices, book lists, announcements, programs, etc. Includes an article Janet Lewis: `To bind despair and joy Into a stable whole.' by Joan Valdes and a preview of The Return of Martin Guerre.
Photographs
